page.title: 18Local News (Radley)
page.content: *A new housing estate is being built where the old Radley College laundry used to be; it is going to be called Badgers Walk. *Norfolk cottage was burnt down a few weeks ago by youths. The roof was burnt out altogether. *Earlier this year a new sports centre was built by the college with an indoor swimming-pool and a large hall which can be used for hockey, basketball etc. *At Peach Croft housing estate some new shops have been built. *Many adults are worried about solvent abuse among young teenagers, and the influence they have on younger children. Someone in the Village found glue sniffers on the playing field and reported them to the police. *Our local policeman helped Radley boys get a piece of ground on which to ride their motorbikes, but because outsiders also used it he had to take it away again.
